channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-7182] ResultSet is not closed in JDBCStatsPublisher#init()
item.description:
ResultSet rs = dbm.getTables(null, null, JDBCStatsUtils.getStatTableName(), null);
        boolean tblExists = rs.next();

rs is not closed upon return from init()

If stmt.executeUpdate() throws exception, stmt.close() would be skipped - the close() call should be placed in finally block.
item.summary: ResultSet is not closed in JDBCStatsPublisher#init()

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Probably not immediately clear from the patch, but why the executeUpdate statement was moved outside the if?

stmt.executeUpdate(createTable);
Changed to Submit Patch so the tests can run.

Overall: -1 no tests executed

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12648909/HIVE-7182.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12648909

executeUpdate wasn't moved outside the if. I moved stmt.close() & closeConnection() finally block.

         if (!tblExists) { // Table does not exist, create it
           String createTable = JDBCStatsUtils.getCreate("");
-          stmt.executeUpdate(createTable);
-          stmt.close();
-        }
-        closeConnection();
+          stmt.executeUpdate(createTable);          
+        }
I reattached the patch after rebase. HIVE-7182.1.patch rebased against current trunk.

Overall: -1 no tests executed
